intro: Microsteira chorigyna subsp. sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis microsteira, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous plant with small, delicate leaves and produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in dense forest understories. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short, branched stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
